Atelerix.hDesc: Also known as the 'four-toed hedgehog', They are one of the most popular types of domesticated hedgehogs sold as pets. Solitary, nocturnal, and energetic, they can run as much as five miles a night!
The next most popular of all domesticated hedgehog breeds, a distant relative of the Algerian hedgehog was domesticated by the Romans in the fourth century to be used for meat, quills, and pets.
The handsome South African hedgehog has a distinctive white stripe on its head against otherwise dark fur. They can be found in countries like Botswana, Namibia, South Africa, and Zimbabwe.
Found only in Somalia, these small hedgehogs have a white belly with brown or black legs.
